                                      City Council

                                      Mayor and City Council

                                      The City of Santa Fe operates under the Council-Manager form of government. The City Council, consisting of a Mayor and five Council members elected at large by the people, is the governing body of the City. The City Council enacts local legislation, adopts budgets, determines policies, sets the tax rate and hires a city manager to administer the city's day-to-day affairs. The City Council is responsible for the scope and functions of the city government through policy-making. This can be accomplished by identifying the needs of local  residents, formulating programs to meet the changing requirements of the community, and measuring the effectiveness of ongoing municipal services. 

                                       

                                      Mayor Brandon Noto (term expires May 2027) - contact at mayor@santafetx.gov


                                       

                                      Mayor Pro Tem Dana Marks - Position 5 (term expires May 2028) - contact at dmarks@santafetx.gov

                                      Council Member Position 1 - Russell W. Schroeder (term expires May 2028) - contact at rschroeder@santafetx.gov

                                      Council Member Position 2 - Ryan McCamy (term expires May 2027) - contact at rmccamy@santafetx.gov

                                      Position 3 Council Member Ronald "Bubba" Jannett (term expires May 2027) - contact at bjannett@santafetx.gov

                                       

                                      Council Member Position 4 John Dickerson (term expires May 2028) - contact at jdickerson@santafetx.gov

                                      Regular Meeting Dates

                                      Jan - Oct the Council meets on the 2nd & 4th Thursday

                                      Nov & Dec the Council meets on the 2nd Thursday

                                      *All regular meetings are held at 7:00 p.m. in the Council Chambers at City Hall.*

                                       

                                      Mission: 

                                      The City of Santa Fe is dedicated to its citizens and to make our community a great place to live, work, and raise a family.

                                      Vision:

                                      Santa Fe is an inclusive community, where small town values are still prevalent. A place where the community's businesses support the citizens as well as employs most of its residents. A harmonic blend of urban growth with the grass roots of a small Texas town.
